Uses of Interface
org.fluentjava.iterators.ExtendedIterable

Packages that use ExtendedIterable
org.fluentjava Package with entry points to most of the concepts on the subpackages. 
org.fluentjava.collections Package with extended collections. 
org.fluentjava.iterators Package with iterators that are themselves iterables. 
 

Uses of ExtendedIterable in org.fluentjava
 

Methods in org.fluentjava that return ExtendedIterable
static ExtendedIterable<java.lang.Integer> FluentUtils.irange(int stop)
           Calls FluentUtils.irange(int, int) passing 0 as start.
protected  ExtendedIterable<java.lang.Integer> Fluency.irange(int range)
          Delegates to FluentUtils.irange(int), passing range as argument.
static ExtendedIterable<java.lang.Integer> FluentUtils.irange(int start, int stop)
          This method creates a ExtendedIterator of a sequence of Integer starting from start (including) and ends at stop (excluding).
protected  ExtendedIterable<java.lang.Integer> Fluency.irange(int start, int stop)
          Delegates to FluentUtils.range(int, int), passing start and stop as argument.
 

Uses of ExtendedIterable in org.fluentjava.collections
 

Subinterfaces of ExtendedIterable in org.fluentjava.collections
 interface Enumerable<E>
          Implements a enumeration protocol.
 interface FluentList<E>
          List that has type safe toArray, and has a fluent interface on methods.
 interface FluentMap<K,V>
          Map that has a fluent interface on methods.
 interface FluentSet<E>
          Set that has type safe toArray, and has a fluent interface on methods.
 

Classes in org.fluentjava.collections that implement ExtendedIterable
 class Dictionary<K,V>
          Standard Implementation of Fluent map.
 class Enumerator<E>
          Class that takes an iterable, and implements all Enumerable methods using only its iterator.
 class ExtendedSet<E>
          Standard implementation of FluentSet.
 class Sequence<E>
          Standard implementation of FluentList.
 

Fields in org.fluentjava.collections declared as ExtendedIterable

Uses of ExtendedIterable in org.fluentjava.iterators
 

Subinterfaces of ExtendedIterable in org.fluentjava.iterators
 interface ExtendedIterator<T>
          An iterator that is itself iterable.
 

Classes in org.fluentjava.iterators that implement ExtendedIterable
 class AbstractExtendedIterator<T>
          ExtendedIterator that does the default behaviour for iterator() and method: returns itself.
 class CompositeIterator<F,S>
          Iterator that takes two Iterators, Iterables, or Arrays (not necesserily both of the same type), and iterates through both, preserving the order.
 class CountingIterator<T>
          Extended Iterator Adapter that counts how many times next was invoked, mainly used to count the number of the iteration.
 class ExtendedIterableAdapter<T>
          Adapts an Iterable to a ExtendedIterable.
 class ExtendedIteratorAdapter<T>
          Adapter that adapts iterable's iterators, iterators (including extended iterators, making this a wrapper as well) and arrays.
